oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Adressing fraud
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Huber, Beate
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Values, standards and certification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The rapid development of the organic sector, and the ever increasing demand for organic products have resulted in new challenges for the organic guarantee system. It has also meant that an adequate response along the whole supply chain is required. Acknowledging that this is an important issue, representatives of the trade, certification bodies operating in the international sector and a few authorities met in May 2007 at the Federal Agency for Agriculture and Food (BLE) in Bonn, Germany, to discuss the matter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Huber, Beate (2007) Adressing fraud. The Organic Standard (74), p. 12.
